title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates the pay rates for various federal government employees, including those in statutory pay systems, senior executives, judges, members of Congress, and uniformed service members. It establishes new salary schedules effective early 2023 and supersedes the previous pay adjustment order.
potential_concerns: The pay adjustments could create budget strains that limit other federal workforce investments impacting federal-employees-civil-servants and veterans reliant on VA healthcare.
Uniformed service members (military-personnel-active-duty) may face disparities if locality pay adjustments do not align with cost-of-living changes across different duty stations.
Increasing pay rates for senior executives and political appointees might raise concerns about wage compression or perceived inequities among lower-grade federal employees.
The updated schedules for foreign service officers could affect recruitment and retention if compensation does not keep pace with inflation or international comparators.
Implementation complexities in adjusting pay scales simultaneously across diverse statutory pay systems could cause temporary payroll errors or delays affecting all covered populations.
